commentary.line: That's it from this game. The action now shifts to Eden Gardens, where Kolkata are taking on Delhi. Switch tabs and enjoy the match. For now, take care and Cya!

Morgan: "I felt good. Since I have touched down here, I have worked on a couple of different things. It was a great wicket to bat on. Given the dimensions of the ground, it was better to go straight. Again we came up trumps (talking about the added responsibility he had as there was no Boult and Steyn). Today me, Shikhar (Dhawan) and a bit of Ravi saw it through. We can't rely on the opening pair everytime."
Eoin Morgan is the Man of the Match for his 28-ball 63.

Warner: "We knew that a total around 170-180 was a good score, 200 was a bonus. Before I went up to bat, I seized up. It has happened before, but nothing to worry about. I let the team down by getting out to my fellow team-mate (Watson). We haven't been clicking in the middle order and it was good to do well. We wanted the middle order to gain momentum. It is quite hard to get a smile from Moody, but he is quite a serious man and he has a heart of gold. The positive sign is we batted well on a wicket we were sent in."

The dismissal of Smith - castled by Ravi Bopara, for a 40-ball 68, turned out to be the turning point of the match. Faulkner threw his bat around, but the task was beyond him - caught in the deep for 30. The bowling of the Hyderabad was disciplined, they mixed a lot of slower ones while the yorkers were spot-on, at least until the final stages of the match. It needed the canniness of Bhuvneshwar Kumar, who managed to defend 18 runs from the final over, to ensure that his team stay alive in the tournament.

Chasing 202, Rajasthan needed a quick start, but they ended up losing the wickets of their in-form openers, Ajinkya Rahane and Shane Watson, pretty cheaply. Karun Nair struggled during his brief stay and so did Deepak Hooda. At the other end, Steven Smith batted with a lot of authority and threatened to take the game away. He was well supported by James Faulkner as the duo added 44 runs for the fifth wicket.

Superb cameos from Sanju Samson and Chris Morris nearly created an upset of gigantic levels but Hyderabad and Bhuvneshwar Kumar kept their composure to ensure a 7-run victory. A much needed victory for the Hyderabad and they are back in the tournament. Warner's team move up to the fifth position with 10 points while Rajasthan stay second with 14 points.
19.6   Bhuvneshwar to C Morris, 1 run, HYD win by 7 runs. Bhuvi held his nerve in the final over. Leg-cutter just outside off, Morris mistimes the cut to sweeper cover, the duo get only a single

19.5   Bhuvneshwar to C Morris, FOUR, cracking shot! Bhuvneshwar misses the yorker length, Morris clears his front leg and smacks it straight back past the bowler, the fielder at long-on dives in vain
Warner and Bhuvneshwar have a discussion. Morris is taking a look at the field. Fine leg and third man are inside the ring. Now, the batsmen are having a chat. Two sixes for a Super Over.

19.4   Bhuvneshwar to C Morris, 2 runs, yorker around off, Morris winds up for the mighty heave, the ball squirts off the inside edge towards short fine leg, Ishant dives to his right and makes a half stop. He saved a couple of runs there
19.3   Bhuvneshwar to Binny, 1 run, Binny has missed out there, it was a full toss from Bhuvi, Binny takes a step down and mistimes the big hit to long-on
19.2   Bhuvneshwar to C Morris, 1 run, short and outside off, Morris cuts to sweeper cover, that would have been a wide, if Morris had let it go
19.1   Bhuvneshwar to Binny, 1 run, full toss on the stumps, Binny hammers it past Morris, Bopara runs to his left from long-on and keeps it to a single
22 from Praveen's over means Bhuvi has 18 to defend in the last over.
18.6   P Kumar to Binny, 1 run, almost a yorker around off, Binny can't get underneath that, he squeezes the drive to long-off and keeps strike
18.5   P Kumar to C Morris, 1 run, very full and just short of yorker length, Morris drills it straight to long-on, Warner keeps it to a single
18.4   P Kumar to C Morris, 2 runs, much better, yorker on the stumps, Morris squeezes it in front of long-on, Binny pushes Morris for the second and they take it with ease

18.3   P Kumar to C Morris, SIX, hat-trick of sixes. The change of angle didn't work for Praveen. Drags the slower delivery halfway down the wicket, Morris waits for it and pulls it over deep square leg. The fielder was a mere spectator
Praveen goes round the wicket

18.2   P Kumar to C Morris, SIX, another six and RAJ are still in it. Praveen is dishing out length deliveries, Morris is cashing in, he gets his front leg out of the way and plays the pick-up shot wide of long-on

18.1   P Kumar to C Morris, SIX, great start to the over. Morris is hitting them alright. Full delivery on off and middle, Morris plants his front forward and flicks it in the air towards deep mid-wicket, Morgan runs to his right, dives full length and tries to flick it in, but is not able to do that
Praveen Kumar [3.0-0-18-0] is back into the attack
40 runs off 12 balls. Surely, HYD's game from here on. Or will Binny and Morris pull a rabbit out of the hat?
17.6   Bhuvneshwar to C Morris, 1 run, leg-cutter around off, Morris is early into the shot, adjusts and nurdles it square of the wicket on the leg-side

17.5   Bhuvneshwar to C Morris, FOUR, cheeky! Morris gets going with a pre-meditated shot. The back of the hand slower ball, Morris shuffles across and scoops it over short fine, he just about clear the fielder to pick up four
Chris Morris, right handed bat, comes to the crease

17.4   Bhuvneshwar to Samson, out Bowled!! Bhuvi has the last laugh. Samson's little cameo comes to an end and RAJ are coming apart. It was the slower delivery on a length, Samson goes for the swipe towards cow corner, the under-edges goes on and crashes into the stumps. Samson b Bhuvneshwar 21(10) [6s-3]
Bhuvneshwar to Samson, THATS OUT!! Bowled!!

17.3   Bhuvneshwar to Samson, SIX, consecutive sixes for Samson. He is not giving up just yet. Bhuvneshwar dishes out a full toss on middle and leg, Samson clears his front leg and hoicks it over deep mid-wicket for a maximum

17.2   Bhuvneshwar to Samson, SIX, fabulous shot! That is the second six he has hit effortlessly. Bhuvneshwar misses the yorker and bowls a length ball, Samson lofts it straight down the ground, clears the sightscreen comfortably
Stuart Binny, right handed bat, comes to the crease

17.1   Bhuvneshwar to Faulkner, out Caught by Bopara!! That might be the match for HYD. They have got rid of the big-hitting James Faulkner. It was a low full toss, Faulkner gets underneath it and hammers it flat to long-on, he couldn't get the elevation to clear Bopara, who takes a good catch. Faulkner c Bopara b Bhuvneshwar 30(19) [4s-2 6s-2]
Bhuvneshwar to Faulkner, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
Bhuvneshwar Kumar [2.0-0-17-1] is back into the attack
RAJ still need 57 runs from 18 balls. A lot will depend on Faulkner, who is known for his finishing abilities.
16.6   Bopara to Faulkner, 1 run, drags the slower delivery halfway down the wicket, Faulkner slaps it to extra cover and retains strike

16.5   Bopara to Faulkner, no run, another back of the hand slower ball, Faulkner looks to force it off the back foot, the ball squirts off the inside edge and hits the back pad. If not for the pad, that was going onto the stumps
16.4   Bopara to Samson, 1 run, off-speed delivery on off, Samson shuffles across and scoops, finds the fielder at short fine leg, didn't get it off the middle
16.3   Bopara to Samson, leg byes, 2 runs, slower delivery around off, Samson misses the defensive push, the ball hits the thigh and rolls away fine

16.2   Bopara to Samson, SIX, fantastic shot! This youngster can bat. It was a very straight full delivery, Samson comes forward and plays the pick-up shot, he timed it so well that it cleared the deep mid-wicket fence with ease
16.1   Bopara to Samson, no run, back of the hand slower delivery, Samson was on his knee to play the sweep, the ball does not come on and he ends up jamming it onto the pads
15.6   Henriques to Faulkner, no run, off-cutter outside off, Faulkner cuts and misses, once again deceived by the lack of pace

15.5   Henriques to Faulkner, no run, bouncer outside off, Faulkner was shaping to play the pull, but decided against it. He looks at the umpire for a wide as it was the second short delivery, but he gets nothing
15.4   Henriques to Faulkner, no run, change of pace and Faulkner misses out, he is early into the swipe to cow corner, the ball goes under his bat

15.3   Henriques to Faulkner, FOUR, Faulkner is liking the pace on the ball. Henriques bowls a bumper outside off, Faulkner fetches the pull from there, top-edges it over the keeper and collects another boundary

15.2   Henriques to Faulkner, FOUR, banged in halfway down the wicket, Faulkner pulls to deep mid-wicket, Vihari runs to his right, slides but lets the ball go through his legs. That should have been stopped
15.1   Henriques to Samson, 1 run, off-speed delivery on middle, Samson leans forward and flicks to deep mid-wicket
Moises Henriques [2.0-0-20-1] is back into the attack

14.6   Bopara to Samson, leg byes, 1 run, half hearted appeal for lbw, Samson walks down and across the pitch, Bopara slips in the slower one, Samson misses the flick and is struck on the pad, the impact was outside off though
14.5   Bopara to Faulkner, 1 run, shortish and around off, Faulkner flat-bats it past the non-striker and down to long-on
14.4   Bopara to Faulkner, 2 runs, takes the pace off the ball, Faulkner works it with soft hands in front of square on the leg-side, calls for two and gets it comfortably
14.3   Bopara to Samson, 1 run, Samson walks down the pitch, almost yorks himself, digs it out to long-on
Sanju Samson, right handed bat, comes to the crease

14.2   Bopara to S Smith, out Bowled!! Knocked over! Smith is livid with himself as he bangs his bat hard on the turf. This was a good length delivery on the stumps, Smith backs away and misses the cut, the ball crashed into middle stump. It is a very crucial wicket for HYD as Smith was looking in ominous touch. S Smith b Bopara 68(40) [4s-9 6s-2]
Bopara to S Smith, THATS OUT!! Bowled!!

14.1   Bopara to S Smith, FOUR, good start to the over, back of a length around off, Smith waits for the ball to arrive and pulls it in front of square, between deep mid-wicket and long-on. Some placement that
Ravi Bopara [1.0-0-6-0] is back into the attack
13.6   P Kumar to S Smith, 1 run, low full toss on off, Smith knocks it gently to long-on, called for two first, but settles with one as the fielder gets there quickly
13.5   P Kumar to S Smith, FOUR, there comes the boundary of the over. Pitched up delivery around off, Smith drives it to the left of the bowler, just eludes Praveen and beats Warner at long-off
13.4   P Kumar to Faulkner, leg byes, 1 run, full and on leg-stump, Faulkner misses the flick and the ball rolls away off the pads towards mid-wicket
13.3   P Kumar to S Smith, 1 run, Smith gives the charge, converts it into a fuller length delivery and drives to sweeper cover
13.2   P Kumar to Faulkner, 1 run, change of pace and the length is short, Faulkner pulls straight to deep square leg
13.1   P Kumar to Faulkner, 2 runs, leg-cutter around off, Faulkner nudges it to the vacant mid-wicket region, the batsmen run two before the fielder from the deep comes in to field the ball
Praveen Kumar [2.0-0-9-0] is back into the attack
Time-out
12.6   Karn Sharma to S Smith, no run, expects the ball to be shorter, Smith goes back in the crease and cuts to cover-point, straight to the fielder

12.5   Karn Sharma to S Smith, SIX, RAJ are on the charge now. That is the 4th six in 9 balls. Tossed up delivery just outside off, Smith shimmies down the wicket, goes through with the loft and sends it sailing over long-off. That is some great footwork from Smith
12.4   Karn Sharma to Faulkner, 1 run, slower and on the stumps, Faulkner turns it gently to short mid-wicket and hands the strike back to Smith
12.3   Karn Sharma to Faulkner, no run, stifled appeal for lbw, Faulkner hangs back and misses the straighter one. The ball pitched on leg-stump and would have missed the sticks as well
12.2   Karn Sharma to S Smith, 1 run, quicker and on leg-stump, Smith comes down the track and whips it behind square leg

12.1   Karn Sharma to S Smith, SIX, back-to-back sixes for RAJ. Smith reaches his fifty as well. Flighted delivery on middle, Smith dances down the wicket, gets to the pitch and lofts it handsomely straight back over the bowler's head. Everyone in the RAJ dug-out are up on their feet applauding the innings

11.6   Ishant to Faulkner, SIX, Ishant has been smacked for the second six in the over. Another nice juicy full toss, Faulkner gets his front leg out of the way and hoicks into the crowd at deep mid-wicket
11.5   Ishant to S Smith, 1 run, slower delivery that is dragged short, Smith swipes it across the line to deep mid-wicket

11.4   Ishant to Faulkner, 1 run, very full and on the stumps, Faulkner squeezes it to the right of the bowler, Smith couldn't get out of the way, the ball ricochets off his pads towards mid-wicket. He could have gone for the second, but he doesn't. That is good sportsmanship from Smith
The fourth umpire brings out the box for the onfield umpires to select one that is close to 11 overs old.

11.3   Ishant to Faulkner, SIX, this time Faulkner does not miss out on a full toss. It was on leg-stump, Faulkner says thank you very much and heaves it over backward square for a maximum. The ball is out of the park

11.2   Ishant to S Smith, leg byes, 1 run, Ojha has saved some runs for the team, Ishant drifts onto leg-stump, Smith shuffles across and misses the glance, the ball brushes the pad and was on its way to the fine leg fence before a Ojha intercepted with a dive to his left
11.1   Ishant to Faulkner, 1 run, starts his second spell with a full toss on the pads, Faulkner backs away and works it to deep square leg
Ishant Sharma [2.0-0-10-1] is back into the attack
James Faulkner, right handed bat, comes to the crease

10.6   Karn Sharma to Deepak Hooda, out Caught by Bhuvneshwar!! Just when they started to shift gears, Hooda has thrown it away. This was tossed up well wide of off, Hooda skips out of the crease, doesn't get to the pitch, but still goes through with the loft, skies it towards long-off, Bhuvi misjudged it at first, but did well to hang onto it over his head. Deepak Hooda c Bhuvneshwar b Karn Sharma 7(9)
Karn Sharma to Deepak Hooda, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

10.5   Karn Sharma to Deepak Hooda, 2 runs, again, these two sneak in a second. Karn drags the length back as Hooda shimmies down, the batsman pushes it in front of deep extra cover, hares across for the second and had to put in the dive
10.4   Karn Sharma to Deepak Hooda, no run, floated up outside off, Hooda comes down the track and pads it away, he couldn't get to the pitch of the ball
10.3   Karn Sharma to S Smith, 1 run, uses his feet, gets to the pitch of the ball and drills it to long-on

10.2   Karn Sharma to S Smith, FOUR, Smith on the move now. This was not all that short, he uses the depth of the crease and cuts it right between two fielders, split cover-point and backward point to perfection
10.1   Karn Sharma to S Smith, 2 runs, flighted outside off, Smith advances down the wicket and whips it to the right of long-on, Warner sprints across and tidies up
Karn Sharma [1.0-0-5-0] is back into the attack
9.6   Henriques to S Smith, 1 run, full and way outside off from Henriques, Smith goes a long way across his stumps and works it behind square on the on-side for a single
9.5   Henriques to S Smith, 2 runs, that's excellent running from Smith, pushes a full ball in front of long-on. Ishant was late to get across, Smith runs hard and gets back for the second run
9.4   Henriques to S Smith, FOUR, third boundary of the over, slower bouncer from Henriques, Smith rocks back and pulls it behind square on the on-side, third boundary off the over
9.3   Henriques to S Smith, no run, another slower ball from Henriques, Smith looks to cut and misses, the off-cutter from Henriques, the ball goes to the keeper after two bounces

9.2   Henriques to S Smith, FOUR, this is excellent batting from Smith, another slower ball from Henriques, Smith swivels across, rolls his wrists and pulls it behind square, bisects the two men in the deep for another boundary
9.1   Henriques to S Smith, FOUR, no pace to work with, but Smith manufactures all the power himself, comes down the track, makes room and slaps it past cover for a boundary
Time for the strategic break. RAJ are going nowhere in this chase. The required rate is now closing towards 14 RPO.
8.6   Bopara to Deepak Hooda, no run, slower short ball from Bopara, Hooda cuts it straight to the fielder at point, Smith wanted a run and has to hurry back
8.5   Bopara to S Smith, 1 run, Smith shimmies down the track and chips the slower ball towards deep mid-wicket, another single added to the total
8.4   Bopara to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, another slower ball from Bopara, comes down the track and dabs it away behind square on the off-side for a single
8.3   Bopara to Deepak Hooda, 2 runs, fuller length delivery and just outside off, Hooda looks to drive and gets an inside edge, the ball rolls away towards long-on, Smith is back for the second run
8.2   Bopara to S Smith, 1 run, another slower ball from Bopara, driven down towards long-on for a run
8.1   Bopara to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, slower full toss from Bopara, punched down towards long-on for a single
Ravi Bopara, right-arm medium, comes into the attack

7.6   Henriques to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, back of a length and just outside off, it was the slower ball as well, Hooda flicked it towards mid-wicket and called for a quick single. Praveen fumbles and the run is completed with ease
7.5   Henriques to Deepak Hooda, no run, short and wide from Henriques, Hooda feels for that, ends up playing away from his body and nearly nicks it to the keeper
7.4   Henriques to S Smith, 1 run, on a good length and just outside off, worked towards long-on for a single
Deepak Hooda, right handed bat, comes to the crease

7.3   Henriques to Nair, out Caught by N Ojha!! The pressure of the chase gets to Karun, charges down the track, Henriques slips in the short ball. He was in no position on the pull, gets a fat top-edge to the left of the keeper. Ojha called for the catch, moved across and takes it safely. RAJ have lost their third wicket and are in trouble now. Nair c N Ojha b Henriques 4(10)
Henriques to Nair, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
7.3   Henriques to Nair, wide, full and way outside off from Henriques, Karun was looking to go over extra cover and missed, called as a wide
7.2   Henriques to S Smith, 1 run, another slower ball from Henriques, Smith shuffles across and nudges it towards long-on for a single
7.1   Henriques to Nair, 1 run, Henriques starts with a slower short ball, Karun cuts it square past point for a single
Moises Henriques, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
6.6   Karn Sharma to S Smith, no run, the slider from Karn, Smith made room for the cut and gets an inside edge, the ball went dangerously close to the leg-stump
6.5   Karn Sharma to Nair, leg byes, 1 run, appeal for LBW, but the impact was well outside off, Karun was looking to play the lap sweep and missed
6.4   Karn Sharma to S Smith, 1 run, tossed up and on the stumps, Smith jumps down the track and drives it against the spin, single to long-on
6.3   Karn Sharma to Nair, 1 run, flighted delivery and on the stumps, Karun goes down on his knees, rolls his wrists and sweeps it behind square on the on-side
6.2   Karn Sharma to Nair, 2 runs, tossed up and on off, Karun drives it to the left of long-off, Smith wants the second run and makes it with ease
6.1   Karn Sharma to S Smith, 1 run, Smith shimmies down the track to a well flighted delivery and drives it down towards long-on
Karn Sharma, right-arm leg break, comes into the attack
Time for spin, Karn is into the attack..
5.6   Ishant to Nair, no run, width on offer from Ishant, Karun cuts it straight to the fielder at backward point, just one run from the over
5.5   Ishant to Nair, no run, back of a length and just outside off, dabbed in front of backward point, Karun wants a single and is sent back
5.4   Ishant to Nair, no run, tad fuller and just outside off, driven straight to the fielder at cover
5.3   Ishant to Nair, no run, on a good length and around the off-stump line, Karun defends it back towards the bowler
5.2   Ishant to S Smith, 1 run, short of a length and on the stumps, flicked away in front of square on the on-side for a single
5.1   Ishant to S Smith, no run, Ishant shortens the length as Smith came down the track, defended towards point
4.6   P Kumar to Nair, no run, short of a length and just outside off, Karun gets behind the line and blocks it

4.5   P Kumar to S Smith, 1 run, dropped by Henriques, Smith is living a charmed life, pitched up and on Smith's pads, he shuffled across and flicked it in the air over square leg. Henriques made a lot of ground from deep mid-wicket, gets to the ball and shells it as he slid. How costly will this life prove to be?

4.4   P Kumar to S Smith, FOUR, edged and four, this was the awayswinger from Praveen, gets it to wobble in the air and nips away, lures Smith into the drive, finds the outside edge and the ball goes through the vacant slip cordon
4.3   P Kumar to S Smith, no run, on a good length and in that channel around off, Smith pushes forward and gets an inside edge towards square leg
4.2   P Kumar to S Smith, no run, another shout for LBW, but this was going over the top. Pitched up and holding its line around middle, Smith was shuffling across on the flick and missed
4.1   P Kumar to S Smith, no run, appeal for LBW, but the ball was slipping down leg, Smith was looking to flick and missed. The impact was outside leg
Praveen Kumar [1.0-0-4-0] is back into the attack
Karun Nair, right handed bat, comes to the crease

3.6   Ishant to Watson, out Caught by P Kumar!! That's a half-hearted shot from Watson and he finds Praveen at mid-on. Huge blow for RAJ, this was pitched up and held its line around off, Watson was looking to play the flick over mid-wicket, looked like he checked it at the last moment, ends up spooning it to Praveen at mid-on. That's an absolute dolly, RAJ have lost both openers now. Watson c P Kumar b Ishant 12(12) [4s-3]
Ishant to Watson, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
3.5   Ishant to Watson, no run, tad fuller and in that channel outside off, defended towards the off-side
3.4   Ishant to S Smith, 1 run, on a good length and on the stumps, Smith makes room outside leg-stump and guides it to the left of cover-point, just a single
3.3   Ishant to S Smith, FOUR, cracking shot, width on offer from Ishant, Smith leans forward, presents the full face of the bat and caresses it through extra cover for another boundary
3.2   Ishant to S Smith, no run, on a good length and just outside off, Smith presents the full face of the bat and drives it towards mid-off

3.1   Ishant to S Smith, FOUR, Ishant is on the floor and the ball races away to the fence, full and just outside off, Smith presents the full face of the bat and punches it past mid-on. Ishant lost his balance and fell onto the ground on the followthrough
Ishant Sharma, right-arm fast, comes into the attack
2.6   Bhuvneshwar to Watson, no run, short of a length and well outside off, Watson chops it hard and onto the ground, straight to the fielder at backward point
2.5   Bhuvneshwar to Watson, no run, on a good length and well outside off, driven straight to the fielder at cover

2.4   Bhuvneshwar to Watson, FOUR, edged and four, full and wide from Bhuvneshwar, Watson went hard on the drive, gets a thick edge that flies past the diving first slip fielder, another boundary for Watson
2.3   Bhuvneshwar to Watson, FOUR, cracking shot, width on offer from Bhuvneshwar, Watson stands tall and punches it square past point, beats the fielder and races away to the fence

2.2   Bhuvneshwar to S Smith, 1 run, Smith gets lucky! The ball landed right in between two fielders. Warner ran across from mid-off, Karn came across from mid-on, both stopped for the other to take the catch, the ball landed right in between them. Going back to the ball, this was a mistimed pull from Smith, got a top-edge on the shot
2.1   Bhuvneshwar to S Smith, no run, on a good length and in that channel outside off, Smith presses across and punches it back at the bowler
1.6   P Kumar to Watson, no run, another big inswinger from Praveen, Watson looks to flick and gets an inside edge onto the thigh pad
1.5   P Kumar to Watson, no run, back of a length and just outside off, Watson stays behind the line and punches it towards mid-on

1.4   P Kumar to Watson, FOUR, that's sublime from Watson, swings this one onto Watson's pads, he gets inside the line and flicks it past square leg, beats the man getting across from the deep, off the mark with a boundary
1.3   P Kumar to Watson, no run, fuller length delivery and swinging onto Watson's pads, he looks to flick and misses, the ball rolls away towards square leg
1.2   P Kumar to Watson, no run, on a good length and well outside off, Watson looks to drive and gets an inside edge. Ojha gets across quickly, puts in the dive and saves some runs
1.1   P Kumar to Watson, no run, fuller length delivery and a hint of shape back into Watson, he prods across and defends it towards the off-side
Praveen Kumar, right-arm medium, comes into the attack
Steven Smith, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Two slips in place for Praveen

0.6   Bhuvneshwar to Rahane, out Caught by N Ojha!! Lovely riposte from Bhuvneshwar, pitched this one up and got it to nibble away a fraction, drew Rahane into the forward push, the outside edge is found. Ojha dives in front of first slip and holds onto a good catch. The orange-cap holder is dismissed cheaply, a huge wicket this for HYD. Rahane c N Ojha b Bhuvneshwar 8(6) [4s-2]
Bhuvneshwar to Rahane, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
0.5   Bhuvneshwar to Rahane, FOUR, full and wide from Bhuvneshwar, that was there to be smashed, Rahane leans into the drive and hammers it past cover, the ball races away in a jiffy

0.4   Bhuvneshwar to Rahane, no run, late away movement for Bhuvneshwar, nearly had Rahane in trouble, this was pitched up and shaped away very late, Rahane closed the face of the bat and gets a leading edge, the ball drops in front of the man at cover

0.3   Bhuvneshwar to Rahane, FOUR, short, wide and four, width on offer from Bhuvneshwar, Rahane quickly gets on top of the bounce and cracks it square of cover, the ball races away to the fence in a hurry
0.2   Bhuvneshwar to Rahane, no run, short of a length and well outside off, cracked straight to the fielder at point
A slip is in place
0.1   Bhuvneshwar to Rahane, no run, on a good length and a hint of away shape, Rahane presses forward and defends it towards cover-point
Rahane and Watson are at the crease. Rahane is on strike. Bhuvneshwar will open the attack
Welcome back.. Warner leads the team huddle. Watson and Rahane stroll into the middle..

Morgan's quickfire 28-ball 63 provided the much needed impetus to the innings. RAJ once again struggled at the death as they leaked 68 runs in the last 5 overs. The pitch is good for batting and HYD don't have either Boult or Steyn, so can defend this score? We shall find out soon as the run-chase is coming up in a short while...

Watson opted to bowl on an absolute belter and his bowlers couldn't respond. Warner and Dhawan got HYD off to a blazing start, but a troublesome back spasm cut short Warner's stay at the wicket. Dhawan, however, continued striking the ball with precision and notched up his 3rd fifty this season. After his dismissal, Morgan took up the mantle and carted the RAJ bowlers all over the park.
19.6   C Morris to Bopara, 1 run, low full toss, flicked straight to the fielder at backward square leg, inside the ring. Just a single
19.5   C Morris to N Ojha, 1 run, 200 is up as Ojha mishits one to long-off. Length on the stumps, but Ojha didn't get under it

19.4   C Morris to N Ojha, no run, Morris had a chance to run Bopara out but he calmly collects the ball and walks back. Gets the yorker right as he follows Ojha who was making room, inside-edged back down the track
19.3   C Morris to Bopara, 1 run, low full toss on the stumps, slogged on the bounce to Smith at long-on
19.3   C Morris to Bopara, wide, Morris fires it well outside off, knows it is a wide after Bopara failed to reach it
19.2   C Morris to N Ojha, 1 run, another low full toss on the stumps, flicked to deep mid-wicket
19.1   C Morris to Bopara, 1 run, low full toss, hit straight to the fielder at long-on
Chris Morris [3.0-0-32-0] is back into the attack

18.6   Faulkner to N Ojha, FOUR, Tambe with a fumble now. Much like Smith he does all the hard work, running to his right at third man but allows the ball to slip under his body on the dive, it was sliced to his right and Tambe put in an awkward effort
Faulkner is fine, he is ready to bowl the final delivery of the over

18.5   Faulkner to Bopara, 1 run, low full toss and Bopara clobbers it hard and at Faulkner, who stuck his left-hand out, taking evasive action, it hits the wrist and goes down. Only an insane man would even begin to think about calling that a drop
18.4   Faulkner to Bopara, no run, slower delivery outside off, Bopara slogs and misses

18.3   Faulkner to Bopara, FOUR, would you believe that - Smith has fumbled one? He is cross with himself and fists hard into the ground. Driven wide of him at long-off, he did all the hard work as he ran to his left and then slid but allowed it to slip through his hands. Did he get a bad bounce? Maybe but Smith is such a fine fielder that he expected to stop the four
18.2   Faulkner to Bopara, no run, full and outside off, but Bopara had already made too much room outside leg and fails to reach it
18.1   Faulkner to N Ojha, 1 run, low full toss outside off, driven straight to the fielder at sweeper cover
18.1   Faulkner to N Ojha, wide, yorker length delivery outside off, called a wide as it was outside the tramline
James Faulkner [3.0-0-26-1] is back into the attack
17.6   Watson to N Ojha, 1 run, slower delivery outside off, Ojha arrested his front foot push and found cover

17.5   Watson to Bopara, 3 runs, look at the sprint from Tambe, he nearly outsprints a much younger Faulkner, but the Aussie gets ahead of his mate and pulls it back just inside the ropes before jumping over the LED ad boards. Short and pulled behind square, it needed a sprint which Faulkner provided along with Tambe
Naman Ojha, right handed bat, comes to the crease

17.4   Watson to Eoin Morgan, out Caught by S Smith!! If this was the Chinnaswamy it would've been a six but here at Brabourne Eoin Morgan has picked out long-off. Another length delivery outside off, right in the hitting zone, Morgan times the loft pretty well, but flat to Smith who won't drop that. They check for the no-ball but Watson was fine there. Eoin Morgan c S Smith b Watson 63(28) [4s-4 6s-5]
Watson to Eoin Morgan, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

17.3   Watson to Eoin Morgan, SIX, VVS and Murali clap and are all smiles in the Hyderabad camp. Full outside off, Eoin Morgan shuffles across deep inside the crease and gets under the lofted hit, hit clean and clears long-on comfortably. Eoin Morgan is hurting Rajasthan big time
17.2   Watson to Eoin Morgan, 2 runs, length outside off, Eoin Morgan comes down the track and flat-bats it to the left of Binny at sweeper. Another two
17.1   Watson to Eoin Morgan, 2 runs, full and outside off from round the wicket, carved to sweeper cover, where the fielder slides to keep it to two
Shane Watson [2.0-0-22-1] is back into the attack
16.6   C Morris to Eoin Morgan, 1 run, full outside off, driven square of the wicket, for a single

16.5   C Morris to Eoin Morgan, FOUR, 50 for Eoin Morgan. Magnificent from the Irishman. Poor from Morris and he knew it, grunted out in frustration after slipping it down leg, all it needed was a deflection and Eoin Morgan got it done, beating short fine inside the ring

16.4   C Morris to Eoin Morgan, SIX, belted. Eoin Morgan charged the big Morris and carted it flat and into the sightscreen. It was bowled on a back of a length but Morgan timed it superbly. This must hurt Rajasthan now
Now Morris round the wicket

16.1   C Morris to Bopara, 1 run, length outside off, punched to long-on, Eoin Morgan is back on strike

Nothing the bowler can do there, Eoin Morgan supplying the magic late on for the Hyderabad. 18 off that over

13.5   Deepak Hooda to Dhawan, SIX, there was a fielder at deep backward square but the ball sailed over his head. Full on off, a top-edged slog sweep and Dhawan gets to fifty in the process. Warner and his mates are up to applaud that effort

Shane Watson, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack

Understandable to see the ball slipping out of the bowler's hands as the heat and humdity can cause a lot of sweating

Third man back, sweeper in on the off-side

Warner is still grimacing. As soon as he hit it to the boundary, one saw his face contort
3.4   C Morris to Warner, FOUR, first time Morris has erred in the over and Warner puts him away. It was back of a length outside off, Warner flat-bats it past Morris and beats mid-on too

3.2   C Morris to Warner, 2 runs, looked like a change of pace, the cutter, Warner hops a little and wrists it between mid-on and mid-wicket for a couple

What do we have here between overs - Warner is down on the ground and the physio was pressing his back. One saw a grimace from Warner after he got up. But for now he continues to bat on

2.2   D Kulkarni to Dhawan, FOUR, too much width from Kulkarni and Dhawan has flashed that away to the third man fence. Came off a thick outside edge but it raced away over slip giving third man no chance

Dhawal Kulkarni, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
Morris got steepling bounce and caused Warner problems in that over
1.6   C Morris to Warner, no run, that is a fine opening over apart from the first delivery, another delivery that rises on Warner who adjusts and dabs the cut to point

1.4   C Morris to Warner, no run, this one kept a touch low, short of length outside off, Warner rises to tap it to short cover
1.3   C Morris to Warner, no run, again Morris gets disconcerting bounce from a length, pitches outside leg and raps Warner high on the thigh pad, Warner was on the hop there
1.2   C Morris to Dhawan, 1 run, short of length outside off, bit of extra bounce, cut to square third man

1.1   C Morris to Dhawan, leg byes, FOUR, poor first delivery from Morris, down leg, all it needed was a faint tickle which Dhawan provided, beats Tambe at short fine and races away. Hello - hang on; it has been given as leg byes
Chris Morris, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack

0.6   Deepak Hooda to Warner, FOUR, 13 off the opening over. Actually Deepak Hooda did well there, cramped Warner on the cut but he managed to get it past the dive of Jinks at cover-point. Not well-timed but once it beat Rahane it was four
0.5   Deepak Hooda to Warner, FOUR, there goes Warner. One ball is enough for a sighter. Down the track and then smashes it flat over cover
0.4   Deepak Hooda to Warner, no run, flighted delivery on the stumps, Warner makes room and tries to go inside out but hits it straight to the fielder at mid-off
0.3   Deepak Hooda to Dhawan, 1 run, Dhawan comes down the track and then works this through mid-wicket for a single
0.2   Deepak Hooda to Dhawan, FOUR, elegantly driven wide of cover. Tossed up and outside off, Dhawan got forward and drove it on the rise and in the gap. Nice way to get off the mark
One ball into the match and Dhawan already has issues with movement behind the bowler's arm. Nuisance this!
0.1   Deepak Hooda to Dhawan, no run, flatter and on the stumps, Dhawan gets forward to block with bat and pad close together
Dhawan and Warner are at the crease. Dhawan is on strike. Deepak Hooda will open the attack
A surprise first up it will be Deepak Hooda to begin proceedings. The countdown begins and ends quickly. Hooda will come from round the wicket. No close-in catchers in place

All set for the action. It is a scorching hot afternoon in Mumbai. Will definitely test the players in the middle. Let's see how they cope up with such stifling conditions. The Rajasthan jog out as do the openers. For Hyderabad to have any chance it is up to Dhawan and Warner to fire. Whether they can do so remains to be seen
Teams:
Rajasthan (Playing XI): Ajinkya Rahane, Shane Watson(c), Karun Nair, Steven Smith, Sanju Samson(w), Deepak Hooda, James Faulkner, Stuart Binny, Dhawal Kulkarni, Chris Morris, Pravin Tambe
Hyderabad (Playing XI): David Warner(c), Shikhar Dhawan, Naman Ojha(w), Moises Henriques, Eoin Morgan, Ravi Bopara, Hanuma Vihari, Karn Sharma, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Praveen Kumar, Ishant Sharma
Warner: 'We need to score more runs in the middle. We have come in today with a lot of pride and will to win. Ishant Sharma is in for Bipul Sharma. Ravi Bopara replaces Dale Steyn.

Watson: 'We will bowl. No particular reason, nice grass cover, will not change a lot. We just need to continue to get better, need to play the perfect game. Two changes, Chris Morris is in place of Tim Southee and Pravin Tambe replaces Rajat Bhatia.'
Rajasthan have won the toss and have opted to field

Weather Report: It's a clear day with temperatures expected to hover around 32 degree Celsius. But with humidity levels at 72%, it's going to be an energy sapping day, especially for the team fielding first.
Head-to-Head record: The two teams have faced each other 6 times with the Rajasthan enjoying a 4-2 winning advantage.

On the other hand, Hyderabad have struggled to make the most of their quality overseas professionals. The gaping hole in the middle order hasn't been sorted out and the team depends heavily on its two openers, David Warner and Shikhar Dhawan. Kane Williamson has been surprisingly jettisoned while Eoin Morgan and Ravi Bopara haven't made most of their opportunities. Hyderabad' bowling has been their strong point, but the team management has been forced to break the Steyn-Boult combination, owing to their weak batting line-up. Coach Tom Moody has conceded that the middle order has been a huge cause of concern. With tougher matches lying ahead, the Hyderabad franchise can't afford any more losses.

After being winless for five matches, the Watson-led Rajasthan stormed back to winning ways, thrashing Delhi in their last match. With 14 points in their kitty, they are pretty well placed at second position. There's an incentive for finishing in the top two, with the teams getting two chances at reaching the final. For that to happen though, Rajasthan can't falter going into the final stages of the tournament. Ajinkya Rahane is the owner of the orange cap while Shane Watson and Steven Smith have held their own with the bat. Tim Southee has been a revelation with the new ball but Rajasthan must solve their death overs problems with the ball. It's an issue that has cost them more than just one match this season and it might come back to haunt them - going into the business end of the tournament.

14:45 Local Time, 09:15 GMT: It's Match 41 of the Indian Premier League and Rajasthan host Hyderabad. A completely different scenario for both teams today. A win will all but seal RAJ's place in the playoffs and put HYD's chances in jeopardy. On the other hand, HYD need to win to keep themselves in the hunt for a place in the playoffs. Mumbai's Brabourne Stadium will play host to what should be a battle between the two Australian skippers, Warner v Watson.

Preview

Two play-off spots are potentially up for grabs and five teams are vying for it in IPL 2015. Hyderabad are currently in the tail-end of the mid-table scramble. One slip-up and their chances could take a big dent.

Rajasthan, on the other hand, are in a comfortable position and they will be buoyed by the fact that they have finally got back to winning ways. The win over Delhi has boosted their campaign after a middle period during which they failed to win. The main aim for Rajasthan will be to sustain their consistency and ensure they finish in the top two.

Venue: Brabourne Stadium, Mumbai

Date: May 7, 2015

Time: 16:00 IST

Weather: High of 35 degrees with clear skies

Team news

Rajasthan

The team ticked all the right boxes in the game against Delhi and they may not change the combination.

Probable XI

1 Ajinkya Rahane, 2 Shane Watson (c), 3 Karun Nair, 4 Steven Smith, 5 Sanju Samson (wk), 6 Stuart Binny, 7 Deepak Hooda, 8 James Faulkner, 9 Rajat Bhatia, 10 Dhawal Kulkarni, 11 Tim Southee

Hyderabad

The team is still heavily reliant on the contributions of David Warner and Shikhar Dhawan. Against the Kolkata, the bowling lacked purpose, with the likes of Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Dale Steyn conceding more than nine runs per over. The fact that Praveen Kumar bowled only one over was baffling. With Eoin Morgan struggling and the rest of the Indian bench proving to be ineffective, Hyderabad will have to strengthen their batting if they are to make a mark.

Probable XI

1 David Warner (c), 2 Shikhar Dhawan, 3 Naman Ojha (wk), 4 Moises Henriques, 5 Eoin Morgan/Kane Williamson, 6 Hanuma Vihari, 7 Karn Sharma, 8 Bipul Sharma, 9 Praveen Kumar, 10 Bhuvneshwar Kumar, 11 Dale Steyn/Trent Boult

Stats

- Shikhar Dhawan needs 59 runs to reach the 1000-run mark for Hyderabad while David Warner needs 90 runs.

- Ajinkya Rahane needs 63 runs to become the second Rajasthan batsman to reach 2,000 runs after Shane Watson.

Quotes

The next five games are on good wickets and our bowlers have been defending well so we're looking forward to playing there on those good wickets: David Warner is still positive despite losing to Kolkata.

I knew I was batting really well and played a rash shot in the last match. I was very hurt by that and wanted to make this count: Ajinkya Rahane after his unbeaten 91 against Delhi.
Teams:

Hyderabad (From): David Warner(c), Shikhar Dhawan, Naman Ojha(w), Moises Henriques, Eoin Morgan, Hanuma Vihari, Bipul Sharma, Karn Sharma, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Dale Steyn, Praveen Kumar, Ishant Sharma, Lokesh Rahul, Parvez Rasool, Ashish Reddy, Ricky Bhui, Chama Milind, Kane Williamson, Ravi Bopara, Trent Boult, Prasanth Padmanabhan, Siddarth Kaul

Rajasthan (From): Shane Watson(c), Ajinkya Rahane, Karun Nair, Steven Smith, Sanju Samson(w), Deepak Hooda, Stuart Binny, James Faulkner, Rajat Bhatia, Tim Southee, Dhawal Kulkarni, Abhishek Nayar, Ben Cutting, Dishant Yagnik, Vikramjeet Malik, Ankit Sharma, Rahul Tewatia, Pravin Tambe, Chris Morris, Dinesh Salunkhe, Rusty Theron, Pardeep Sahu, Brainder Sran, Sagar Trivedi
